meta.why: Understanding your body's protection system helps you distinguish between real danger and false alarms. This knowledge can reduce fear and increase confidence in movement.

hero.title: Protectometer
hero.subtitle: Finding safety cues vs danger signals
hero.description: Your brain has a sophisticated protection system that can sometimes overreact. Learning to identify safety cues helps calm your nervous system and reduce unnecessary pain signals.

tiles.title: **Safety Cues**
content: Stiffness that warms up with activity
No swelling or signs of inflammation

microAction.title: Safety Check
microAction.description: Think of a movement you've been avoiding. Rate your fear level (1-10) and try a very gentle version. Notice if it's actually dangerous or just uncomfortable.
